linesOfText.text:
Don’t be a manner
monster.

Don’t talk with your mouth
full of food.

Do wait until you have swallowed
your bite to speak.
“I love Floop-A-Loops for breakfast.”

Don’t interrupt others
while they are talking.

Do wait until you hear a silence and
then speak.
“Mommy, you look very pretty.”

Don’t keep your napkin
wadded up in a ball on the
table.

Do place your napkin on your
lap when you sit down to eat.
“This looks delicious.”

Don’t push people out of your
way when you are trying to pass.

Do say “excuse me” and wait for people
to move before you walk by them.
“Excuse me, sir.”

Don’t just open a closed door
as you don’t know what's on
the other side.

Do knock first and wait for a
reply before you enter a room.
“Come on in, Chloe.”

Don’t be a mess when going out
on a play date.

Do wear clean clothes and
remember to brush your hair
and teeth before you go out.
“I love your shoes.”

Don’t just take your present
and run.

Do remember to say “thank you” after
receiving a gift.
“Thank you for the pretty scarf, Mommy.”

Don’t run and jump on the
furniture.

Do run and jump on the
playground.
“This is fun!”

Don’t be rude and cut
in lines.

Do be patient and wait your turn.
“This was definitely worth the wait.”

Don’t be upset if you don’t
win the game.

Do congratulate the winner.
“Congratulations! You played a great game.”

Don’t just take something
without asking permission first.

Do remember to say “please.”
“May I borrow your pencil, please?”
Don’t scream. We can hear you.

Do talk with an inside voice and make eye contact.
“Ms. Smith, did you see
that spider?”

Don't open the door
to strangers.

Do ask who it is at the door and then tell
an adult. “Mommy, Auntie Andrea is here."

Do look both ways and wait until
it is safe to cross a street.
“No cars. Let’s go.”

Don’t stand on your seat or make faces
at other people in restaurants.

Do stay seated at a dining
table and enjoy your meal
with your family.
“Please pass the carrots.”
Don't make fun of people who aren’t like you.

Do become friends and learn from others’
differences. “Nice shot Greg.
You play really well.”

Don't just rush into an elevator
as soon as the doors open.

Do let everyone out of the elevator
first before you enter.
“What floor would you like?”
Don't cough without covering your mouth.
Do cough into your arm. “Are you okay?”

Don't tell a lie.
It only hurts people.

Do tell the truth.
Honesty is the best policy.
“I did it. I’m sorry.”

Do remember to be kind to others and
always practice good manners.
